help.title: Alias-Addressbook Administration
help.information: The XAMS Addressbook is designed to create an Addressbook for Sites, Users, Aliases, Resellers and Customers. The Fields for the addressbook (e.g. Name, Street, ...) must be created by you, allowing you to define exactly the fields you want or need for each system.

section.head: Fieldname
section.description: Enter a fieldname that should be available to your Alias-Addressbook.

section.head: LDAP
section.description: With LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) XAMS provides the ability to export specific addressbook-fields into such database. This LDAP database can be used by different applications as a global addressbook.

section.head: ACL Reseller
section.description: The ACL Reseller (Access Control List) is used for limiting access of resellers to this field. The option "None" disables all access rights for the Reseller (no read or write access). "Read" or "Read+Write" allow the Reseller to read or even modify this field.

section.head: ACL Customer
section.description: Same as ACL Reseller - you can set access rights for your Customers here.

section.head: Move Field
section.description: This function changes the order of how the fields should appear in the interface. The selectbox shows every existing Fieldname; select an entry to move the current field below the selected field.

section.head: Delete
section.description: If you activate the selectbox in any line and click update the selected lines will be deleted. NOTE: Data of all Aliases, that were in those fields will be deleted!
